codes.verbatim_quote: the catalog interface seems to be quite intuitive
codes.context: First impression during warm-up exploration of the system homepage and catalog view

codes.verbatim_quote: it takes a little bit, it takes a little bit of time to elaborate everything
codes.context: Waiting for the system to load catalog content during initial exploration

codes.verbatim_quote: it kind of reminds me of Zenodo interface
codes.context: Drawing comparisons between HERITRACE and familiar repository system Zenodo

codes.verbatim_quote: it would be better to have a preview, not just by clicking on the single items, but when you access the page, everything that is already clearly open, just like Zenodo does
codes.context: During new entity creation, user expressed frustration about having to manually click on each property to expand it. Would prefer all form fields visible immediately like in Zenodo interface

codes.verbatim_quote: It's not clear to me where to find the mentioned article
codes.context: Confusion about how to locate the specific journal article referenced in task instructions

codes.verbatim_quote: I edited this field. So I both edited the name and the ORCID, and I think I have to confirm
codes.context: Successfully modifying author information including name and ORCID identifier
Expressing satisfaction after successfully confirming changes to author information

codes.verbatim_quote: it's not clear to me how I have to navigate
codes.context: Uncertainty about how to navigate to the author page for Richard Carew

codes.verbatim_quote: I realized that I put the current Scagel instead of the first author
codes.context: Self-awareness of making an error by adding author in wrong position

codes.verbatim_quote: it's not clear to me how I have to restore time machine
codes.context: Initial confusion about the process for restoring a previous version using Time Machine feature

codes.verbatim_quote: I'm going back to this first, no, what's that? So I'm starting from the first task
codes.context: Restarting task execution after encountering confusion and errors

codes.verbatim_quote: This is very intuitive. I really like this merging
codes.context: Expressing strong satisfaction with the entity merging functionality

codes.verbatim_quote: It's very similar to the Drive chronology, so it's easy to use, I think
codes.context: Drawing comparison between Time Machine feature and Google Drive version history

codes.verbatim_quote: I don't have the button to restore the version... even if I managed to restore a previous version as a first attempt, after adding another edit, I couldn't restore the first version
codes.context: User encountered a system bug: editing first author directly (instead of adding new author as first in sequence) prevented Time Machine snapshot generation, making restore button unavailable. User successfully restored once but subsequent edit triggered the bug

codes.verbatim_quote: I will put it this way, so I can follow all that
codes.context: Arranging workspace to view task instructions while using the system

codes.verbatim_quote: It's not clear to me what. So journal, I put the journal
codes.context: User accidentally created duplicate journal identifier due to deep nesting of journal within issue/volume/article structure. System validation error about missing required fields caused confusion until user discovered and deleted the excess identifier

codes.verbatim_quote: It seems quite right to me now
codes.context: Checking own work to ensure metadata fields appear correct before submission

codes.verbatim_quote: The error messages during the saving phase were explicit and allowed me to fix the mistakes
codes.context: Written reflection: user appreciated clear validation error messages that helped identify and correct mistakes during save operations
